entries.content: Session started: Creating Gemini its own indicator template. Need to learn from existing Codex and Claude Code indicator templates first.

Template Structure Analysis:
- Both templates use same structure: outer div with class name (codex-indicator/claude-indicator)
- Inner indicator-container div
- loader-wrapper with loader-2 class
- DNA animation elements (dna-strand, 8x dna-dot)
- Provider-specific SVG icon with unique class (codex-svg/claude-svg)
- loading-text with shimmer-text effect showing "working..."
- Key difference: Only the SVG icon path and the outer/SVG class names change per provider

Templates located at:
src/ui/modules/ui-logic/ui-controllers/chat-controller/message-list/agent-messages-manager/indicator/templates/

Created gemini-indicator.html template following exact same structure as codex/claude indicators:
- Same DNA animation elements (dna-strand, 8 dna-dots)
- Same loading-text with shimmer effect
- Gemini SVG uses viewBox="0 0 24 24" (same as Codex)
- Gemini icon features 4 blue circles connected with grid pattern (Google's Gemini branding)
- Uses class names: gemini-indicator, gemini-svg for consistency
User wants me to plan first, do it right, slow and think. Going into planning mode to understand the indicator template system before making changes.

Analysis complete - Found root cause:

1. TemplateHtmlLoader.ts (lines 21-64): Auto-discovers ALL .html files in templates/ directory and loads them into window.TEMPLATES. Since gemini-indicator.html exists, it WILL be loaded automatically - no changes needed here.

2. TemplateDiscovery.js (lines 13-24): Hardcoded list with only codex-indicator and claude-code-indicator. Need to add gemini-indicator entry.

3. PlaceholderCreator.js (lines 119-134): getTemplateId() only checks for 'claude' and 'codex/openai' providers. Need to add gemini case.

4. PlaceholderCreator.js (lines 154-181): Shimmer text arrays only have 'claude' and 'codex'. Need to add gemini texts.
User clarification: Don't rebuild anything. Everything is already working - just need to add Gemini as a new indicator to the existing system.

Gemini indicator integration complete:

1. TemplateDiscovery.js - Added gemini-indicator entry to availableTemplates array
2. PlaceholderCreator.js - Added gemini case to getTemplateId() method (returns 'gemini-indicator')
3. PlaceholderCreator.js - Added Gemini shimmer texts (QUANTUM PROCESSING, NEURAL PATHWAYS FORMING, etc.)
4. PlaceholderCreator.js - Updated shimmer text selection logic to check for Gemini provider

All changes are minimal additions to existing working system. No rebuilding required.
User reports: No indicator showing for Gemini. Need to check if template is being loaded and what's happening with template selection.

Complete Gemini Indicator Integration:

PROBLEM: Gemini template was loading and being selected correctly, but CSS was missing causing indicator to not render.

SOLUTION:
1. Created ui-indicator-gemini.css with Google Blue (#4285F4) branding
2. Created shimmer-text-gemini.css with blue gradient shimmer effect
3. Added CSS paths to ResourceManager.ts
4. Added CSS URI tokens to TemplateInjector.ts (INDICATOR_GEMINI_CSS_URI, SHIMMER_TEXT_GEMINI_CSS_URI)
5. Updated CssResourceUris type in ResourceTypes.ts
6. Updated CssUriResolver.ts to resolve new paths
7. Updated base.html to load new CSS files

Build successful. Ready for testing.

Updated Gemini indicator to use official Gemini logo from src/ui/assets/icons/gemini.svg:
- Replaced 4-dot grid icon with official Gemini gradient star/spark logo
- Updated CSS to use gradient colors (#1C7DFF → #1C69FF → #F0DCD6)
- Updated shimmer text gradient to match Gemini branding
- Removed fill/stroke CSS properties since SVG includes its own gradient definition
